intro: Cryptantha clevelandii var. genuina, commonly known as the Cleveland’s cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, thriving in full sun. It has slender, branching stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
